thread.title: Newnan, host East Coweta enter Area 3- tourney as teams to beat
thread.title_full: Newnan, host East Coweta enter Area 3- tourney as teams to beat

title: Newnan, host East Coweta enter Area 3- tourney as teams to beat
text:
Comments 
When Newnan's volleyball program had to make a coaching hire late this summer, one wondered how the Lady Cougars would respond. 
But it didn't take long for this year's varsity team to buy into first-year head coach Krista Wilson's plans for keeping the team on a winning path. 
Newnan's 25 victories - three shy of matching last year's total - have included one over rival East Coweta to claim this year's Coweta County Championship. 
Heading into this week's Area 3- Tournament, the Lady Cougars would like to add another crown as region champs. 
This year's double elimination tournament at East Coweta's John Thrower Gym - which opens with four matches tonight before concluding on Saturday - has both county rivals as the teams to beat, with Newnan (25-12, 7-0) entering as regular season champions with the No. 1 overall seed. 
Host East Coweta, meanwhile, is hoping a brutal nonregion schedule pays big dividends in the postseason. The Lady Indians (19-20, 6-1) will look to defend its region championship while trying to build momentum heading into the state playoffs. This year's schedule, which came after a trip to last year's Class Final Four, has included a bevy of stateranked and out-of-state opponents to beef up the schedule. 
Newnan's schedule also has included a non-region victory against state power McIntosh, defeating the Lady Chiefs in four sets. 
The Lady Cougars, led by seniors Jenni Young, Anna Brumby, Meg Oldham, and Ansley Knight, have won six of their last seven matches, including beating Northgate 2-0 in the last regular season contest earlier this week while also falling to Sandy Creek. 
East Coweta has revenge on its mind heading into the tournament. 
After advancing to the Final Four a year ago, East Coweta played one of the toughest non-region schedules in the state, losing to state powers such as Woodward Academy, and Woodstock. 
However, the Lady Indians knocked off Roswell twice among their non-region wins. 
After losing to Newnan, East Coweta swept through the remaining area portion of the schedule without losing a set. 
One of the keys this season for the Lady Cougars was replacing Jessi Bartholomew, now a freshman at Duke University. 
Seniors Sydney Winters and Dominique Ingram have picked up the slack for the Lady Indians. Winters enters the tournament with 290 kills, while Ingram has 275 kills and 80 blocks. 
Riley Padgett has 35 aces and 387 digs, and Peyton Smith 25 aces and 118 digs. 
Other first-round a games include No. 4 Douglas County (27-10, 4-3) vs No. 6 Pebblebrook (4-12, 2-5) and No. 3 Campbell (15-9, 5-2) vs. No. 5 Westlake (13-12, 3-4), both at 5:30. 
Two losers bracket games are also scheduled tonight at 7:30. 
The Area 3- tournament resumes Saturday at 9:30 a.m.. A best three-out-offive championship match is scheduled for 2 p.m. More
